      • orderedInsert

        protected <T> void orderedInsert(String order,
                     List<T> objects,
                     T object,
                     IOrderName<T> orderName)
        This function takes a String of the format "name,name2,name3" used to orderly insert an object into an existing list. This function will try and insert an incoming object relative to any other objects that already exist in the list and in the order String. If the existing objects are not ahead of this object in the order list it will insert before, otherwise it will insert after the object closest to it in the ordering list that exists in the list. If the order String does not contain the incoming object it is appended to the end.
        Parameters:
        order - String specifying the order
        objects - list of objects already in the list
        object - the object to insert
        orderName - a function to retrieve the name of the object for ordering
